summary: Build a fully responsive WordPress Yoga Schools Directory for Yoga Alliance teacher training programs (200/300/500 hours), including school listings with associated teacher information, custom branding using the provided logo, an FAQ section on each school page, a Google Map option per school, a similar-schools list on school detail pages, and a new School Review section on school detail pages.
architectural_notes: WordPress-based directory website with responsive design requirements.
UI styling requirement: use a white background site-wide ("everywhere"), not just on the directory page, while maintaining readable contrast.
known_issues: Production deployment failed with a deployment error (Version 1 could not be deployed to production).
Users see "Failed to load schools. Please try again later." indicating the frontend cannot fetch school listings from the backend (actor/load error, backend error, or empty/unseeded data).
Schools are still not showing in the UI; users continue to see "Failed to load schools. Please try again later." after the latest deployment (Version 9).
After deploying Version 15, users still see "Failed to load schools. Please try again later." (schools not loading / frontend fetch still failing).
School listing cards have unwanted top margin (spacing) that the user wants removed/adjusted.
"View details" element needs additional bottom margin/spacing (layout tweak requested).
After deploying Draft Version 18, the Directory page still shows "Failed to load schools. Please try again later." (schools not loading / frontend fetch still failing).

existing_features.title: Build a fully responsive frontend directory UI that lists yoga schools and allows filtering by training hour categories (200/300/500).
Show each school’s teachers on the school listing experience (school card and/or school detail page) so users can see teachers associated with a school.
Apply the provided logo (logo_school_.webp) as the app’s primary brand mark in the UI (e.g., top navigation/header) and ensure it renders crisply across responsive layouts.
Establish a coherent visual theme for the directory (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) and apply it consistently across all pages and states.

Add a responsive banner section at the top of the school listing page (DirectoryPage) that visually reads as a page banner (full-width within the container, prominent background image, and text overlay), replacing or upgrading the current plain text "Hero Section" so it still displays the existing title and subtitle.
Add the required banner image as a generated static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference it from the DirectoryPage banner background.
Add an FAQ section to the School Detail page (route: `/school/$schoolId`) that displays a list of frequently asked questions and answers in English using an accessible expand/collapse UI.

Implement the FAQ section as a reusable component and integrate it into `frontend/src/pages/SchoolDetailPage.tsx` without changing any immutable UI component source files under `frontend/src/components/ui`.
Add a reusable Image Gallery section component for yoga schools and integrate it into the School Detail page route (`/school/$schoolId`) so users can browse multiple photos for a school.

Add a static set of generated gallery images under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and wire the Image Gallery section to use these images (at minimum as default/demo photos) without routing images through the backend.

Create a reusable School video embed section component that can render an embedded YouTube video from a provided YouTube URL or video ID, with a responsive 16:9 layout, accessible title attributes, and a graceful empty/invalid state message in English.
Integrate the YouTube video embed section into the School Detail page route (/school/$schoolId) so each school page displays a video section alongside the existing content sections.
Wire the School Detail page to use the school’s optional YouTube video URL from backend data when rendering the video embed section.
Add a Google Maps location option on the School Detail page (`/school/$schoolId`) that lets users view the school’s location on Google Maps using the existing `school.location` text field.

Implement the Google Maps option as a reusable React component (e.g., `frontend/src/components/school/SchoolMapSection.tsx`) that can render either a responsive embedded map iframe or a link-only fallback without requiring any API key.

Add a “Similar Schools” section to the School Detail page that lists a small set of other schools related to the current school (excluding the current school), and allows navigation to each similar school’s detail page.

Create a reusable, styled "About School" section component (title + description, English text) and render it on every School Detail page (`/school/$schoolId`). The section must visually match existing school page sections by using the same Card-based styling and spacing conventions. The title must read "About School" and the description must be a readable paragraph; when no school-specific about text exists, show a sensible default English description that can reference the current school’s name/location.

Redesign the School Detail page “Training Programs” section UI to match the style of the provided reference (uploaded image) by presenting each training as a distinct, modern course card with stronger hierarchy and richer metadata presentation, while still using the existing backend Training data (hours + description).

Add a reusable React component for the upgraded trainings UI (e.g., `frontend/src/components/school/SchoolTrainingCoursesSection.tsx`) and integrate it into `frontend/src/pages/SchoolDetailPage.tsx`, replacing the current inline “Training Programs” rendering block.

Include two call-to-action buttons in each training card (“View Curriculum” and “Inquire Now”) with graceful, accessible fallback behavior when no real links/actions are available in the current data model.

Harden the frontend schools fetch so failures produce actionable diagnostics while keeping user-facing messaging in English, and avoid showing a generic error when the backend simply returns an empty array.

Enable the “View Curriculum” button in `frontend/src/components/school/SchoolTrainingCoursesSection.tsx` and make it open a dedicated curriculum experience for the selected training (instead of being disabled), using a UX modeled after the uploaded reference image (course header + highlights + pricing/accommodation-style blocks where appropriate) and optimized for best user experience.

Add a new curriculum route and page so the curriculum view is deep-linkable and works with browser navigation (back/forward), e.g. a route under the existing school detail context such as `/school/$schoolId/training/$trainingId` (or an equivalent route pattern consistent with the current TanStack Router setup in `frontend/src/App.tsx`).

Design the curriculum view content to work with the current backend data model (Trainings provide `hours` and `description`) by deriving or presenting meaningful sections without requiring backend changes. Include a well-structured layout similar to the reference (for example: Course Highlights and Pricing & Accommodation blocks), and clearly label any placeholder/demo values as such if real data is unavailable.

Create a reusable frontend School Reviews section component and integrate it into `frontend/src/pages/SchoolDetailPage.tsx` so each school detail page displays existing reviews and allows authenticated users to submit a new review.

Add React Query hooks for fetching and submitting school reviews that use the existing actor infrastructure (`frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`) and provide robust, user-friendly error handling in English.

Create the additional required directory pages as dedicated routes in the existing TanStack Router setup, so the directory experience includes standard supporting pages beyond the listing and detail views.
Update the directory page styling so the directory background is white in light mode, and adjust color/placement as needed to maintain readable contrast and a clean layout.
Add simple navigation entry points to the new directory supporting pages from the existing layout so users can discover them.

Update the global app styling so that all pages and the overall layout use a white background in light mode (not just the Directory page), including the body background, route content area, header/footer surfaces, and any page-level wrappers that currently inherit a non-white background. Keep dark mode behavior intact unless it is necessary to ensure readable contrast.

Update the school listing card UI (`frontend/src/components/directory/SchoolCard.tsx`) to render a demo thumbnail image for each school above the school name/location, using a consistent aspect ratio, responsive sizing, and accessible `alt` text in English.

Add a small set of generated demo school thumbnail images under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and wire the Directory listing to select a deterministic thumbnail per school (e.g., by stable mapping from `school.id`, with a sensible default fallback) without routing images through the backend.

Improve frontend diagnostics for the school loading failure so the console logs include actionable details (method name, error object, and whether an actor exists), while keeping the user-facing message in English as "Failed to load schools. Please try again later."

Remove the unwanted top spacing above the thumbnail image in the school listing card component so each card’s image is flush with the top border of the card (no extra top margin/padding), matching the issue shown in the uploaded screenshot.

Add additional bottom spacing below the "View Details" call-to-action on each school listing card by increasing bottom padding/margin in `frontend/src/components/directory/SchoolCard.tsx` (either on the `CardFooter` container or the `Button`) so the button does not appear flush with the bottom edge of the card.

Update the frontend Directory error state to provide a user-actionable retry control while keeping the existing user-facing message in English. The retry must re-run the schools query without requiring a full page refresh.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a fully responsive WordPress Yoga Schools Directory site
Support Yoga Alliance teacher training course categories/filters (200/300/500 hours) in the directory
Display each school's teachers on the school listing/detail page
Apply provided logo/branding to the WordPress directory site
Create backend data models and APIs for a Yoga Schools Directory, including schools, associated teachers, and Yoga Alliance teacher training offerings (200/300/500 hours).
Add 6 demo yoga schools to the directory (seed/demo content)

Add seed/demo content so the directory contains 6 demo yoga schools by default, and ensure they appear in the existing directory UI without requiring manual data entry. The seeded demo schools must be created in the Motoko backend using the existing data model (School, Training, Teacher) and be discoverable via the existing frontend fetch path (i.e., `searchSchoolsByName('')`). Each demo school must include: (1) a unique stable `id`, English `name`, and English `location`; (2) at least one training record associated to that school; (3) at least one teacher associated to that school. Across the 6 schools, trainings must collectively cover the 200/300/500 hour categories so the hour filters have matching results. Seeding must be idempotent (safe to run multiple times without trapping due to duplicates).
Add a banner section to the school listing page
Add an FAQ section on each school page (school detail page)
Add an image gallery section (e.g., on each school detail page) to display multiple photos for a yoga school
Add a YouTube video embed section (e.g., on each school detail page) so schools can display an embedded video
Extend the backend School data model to support an optional YouTube video URL per school, and expose it through the existing school fetch path used by the School Detail page.
If the canister has existing stable state, implement a conditional state migration so the new School field is populated safely for existing stored schools (defaulting to null/none).
Add a Google Map option on each school page to show the school location (map embed/link)
Add a "Similar Schools" list/section (e.g., on school detail pages) to help users discover related schools
Add a styled "About School" section (title + description) to every school detail page
Improve the Training & Courses section UI/UX on school pages (presentation and content of trainings/courses)
Fix the backend school listing query path so the Directory page can successfully fetch schools via `searchSchoolsByName('')` without trapping or failing at runtime.

Add idempotent backend demo-data seeding so the directory has schools to display by default after deployment/upgrade, and ensure the seeded data is discoverable via the existing frontend fetch path `searchSchoolsByName('')`.
Improve "View Curriculum" CTA behavior/UX so clicking it opens a dedicated curriculum view (e.g., modal/drawer/page) modeled after the provided reference, with an enhanced user experience
Create a School Review section (e.g., on each school detail page) so users can view and/or leave reviews for a school
Add backend support for school reviews by extending `backend/main.mo` with a Review data model and public canister methods to create and list reviews by school.
Create any required directory pages (additional pages/routes needed for the directory experience beyond current pages)
Update directory page styling so the directory background is white and adjust color/placement in the UI as needed
Use demo images for schools so the school list can display school photos/thumbnails (for preview/testing)

Fix the root cause of the Directory page failing to load schools by ensuring the backend `searchSchoolsByName("")` call does not error at runtime and consistently returns a list (possibly empty) for anonymous users.

Add idempotent backend demo-data seeding so the directory has schools to display by default after deployment/upgrade, and ensure the seeded data is discoverable via the existing frontend fetch path `searchSchoolsByName('')`.
Add bottom margin/spacing below the "View details" element (likely the button/link on school listing cards) to improve layout

Fix the backend `searchSchoolsByName("")` path so it never traps/rejects for anonymous users and consistently returns a `[School]` (possibly empty), ensuring the Directory page can load schools without triggering the generic failure banner.

Ensure the backend has idempotent demo/seed data available immediately after installation and after upgrades so the Directory page has schools to display by default. Seeding must be safe to run multiple times without trapping due to duplicates, and seeded schools must be discoverable via the existing frontend fetch path `searchSchoolsByName("")`.
